page_header: Accessibility statement for Authorised agent accounts
about_this_service_description: This accessibility statement applies to Authorised agent accounts.
service_details: This service is run by Companies House. We want as many people as possible to be able to use this service. For example, that means you should be able to:
accessibility_features: Change colours, contrast levels and fonts using browser or device settings
Zoom in up to 400% without the text spilling off the screen
Navigate most of the website using a keyboard or speech recognition software
Listen to most of the website using a screen reader (including the most recent versions of JAWS, NVDA and VoiceOver)
simplified_text: We've also made the service text as simple as possible to understand.
accessibility_support_link_text: Find out more about accessibility support for Companies House users
abilitynet_advice: AbilityNet has advice on making your device easier to use if you have a disability.
feedback_description: We're always looking to improve the accessibility of this service.
feedback_problem_instruction: If you find any problems that are not listed on this page, contact us using the details on our accessibility support guidance.
enforcement_details: The Equality and Human Rights Commission (EHRC) is responsible for enforcing the Public Sector Bodies (Websites and Mobile Applications) (No. 2) Accessibility Regulations 2018 (the ‘accessibility regulations’). If you're not happy with how we respond to your complaint, contact the Equality Advisory and Support Service (EASS).
technical_information: Technical information about this service's accessibility
technical_details: Companies House is committed to making its website accessible in accordance with the Public Sector Bodies (Websites and Mobile Applications) (No. 2) Accessibility Regulations 2018.
compliance_description: This website is fully compliant with the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines version 2.2 AA standard.
what_were_doing_to_improve: What we're doing to improve accessibility
improvement_measures: Work with real users who have accessibility issues to make sure that our services meet their needs
Carry out internal tests for compliance with Web Content Accessibility Guidelines V2.2 level A and level AA
Recruit users through our user panel and agencies to take part in usability sessions
Build and test our services to meet government accessibility requirements
usability_blog_link_text: Read our blogs about usability to find out more about our user research work.
preparation_date: This statement was prepared on 12 March 2025. It was last reviewed on 05/02/2025.
last_tested: This service was last tested on 5 February 2025. The test was carried out by the Digital Accessibility Centre. They tested the main journey.
